definition:
Let $G \subset {\mathbb{C}}^n$ and let
$f \colon G \to {\mathbb{R}} \cup \{ - \infty \}$ be a plurisubharmonic
function which is not identically $-\infty$. The set
${\mathcal{P}} := \{ z \in G \mid f(z) = - \infty \}$ is called a
[*pluripolar set*]{}.

If $f$ is a holomorphic function then $\log \lvert f \rvert$ is a
plurisubharmonic function. The zero set of $f$ is then a pluripolar set.

[9]{} Steven G. Krantz. [**]{}, AMS Chelsea Publishing, Providence,
Rhode Island, 1992.
